chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
S: Set
G: S -> Prop
Add: S -> S -> S
O: S
Opp: S -> S

Goal:
is_group -> forall x y : S, is_opposite S G Add O x y -> y = Opp x

Premises:
is_opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> S -> Prop
is_group = intern S G Add /\ associativity S Add /\ neutral S G Add O /\ opposite S G Add O Opp : Prop
opp_com : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S), commutativity S Add -> forall x y : S, G x -> G y -> Add x y = O -> is_opposite S G Add O x y
regular_l : is_group -> forall y z : S, G y -> G z -> forall x : S, G x -> Add x y = Add x z -> y = z
neutral : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> Prop
opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
associativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
commutativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
intern : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
BinInt.Z.compare_eq : forall x y : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.compare x y = Eq -> x = y
Eqdep_dec.inj_right_pair_on : forall (A : Type) (x : A), (forall y : A, x = y \/ x <> y) -> forall (P : A -> Prop) (y y' : P x), ex_intro P x y = ex_intro P x y' -> y = y'
Eqdep_dec.K_dec_on : forall (A : Type) (x : A), (forall y : A, x = y \/ x <> y) -> forall P : x = x -> Prop, P eq_refl -> forall p : x = x, P p
BinInt.Z.gt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.gt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.gt = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y = Gt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.gt (_ _)%positive_scope
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.le = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.le (_ _)%positive_scope
BinInt.Z.eq_sym = RelationClasses.Equivalence_Symmetric : RelationClasses.Symmetric eq Expanded type for implicit arguments BinInt.Z.eq_sym : forall x y : BinNums.Z, x = y -> y = x Arguments BinInt.Z.eq_sym [x y]
PeanoNat.Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
Ring_theory.mkmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), req (phi cO) rO -> req (phi cI) rI -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y))) -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y))) -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y))) ->...-> Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi
Ring_theory.SRIDmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> forall reqb : R -> R -> bool, (forall x y : R, reqb x y = true -> req x y) -> Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul (Ring_theory.SRsub radd) (Ring_theory.SRopp (R:=R)) req rO rI radd rmul (Ring_theory.SRsub radd) (Ring_theory.SRopp (R:=R)) reqb (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=R))
BinPosDef.Pos.sub = fun x y : BinNums.positive => match BinPosDef.Pos.sub_mask x y with | BinPosDef.Pos.IsPos z => z | _ => BinNums.xH end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.sub (_ _)%positive_scope
Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x : C, req (phi (copp x)) (ropp (phi x)); morph_eq : forall...
String.eqb_neq : forall x y : String.string, String.eqb x y = false < -> x <> y
BinNat.N.eqf_equiv = {| RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive := fun (x : BinNums.N -> bool) (n : BinNums.N) => eq_refl; RelationClasses.Equivalence_Symmetric := fun (x y : BinNums.N -> bool) (H : BinNat.N.eqf x y) (n : BinNums.N) => eq_sym (H n); RelationClasses.Equivalence_Transitive := fun (x y z : BinNums.N -> bool) (H : BinNat.N.eqf x y) (H0 : BinNat.N.eqf y z) (n : BinNums.N) => eq_trans (H n) (H0 n) |} : RelationClasses.Equivalence BinNat.N.eqf
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct x} : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => BinPosDef.Pos.add y (BinNums.xO (mul p y)) | BinNums.xO p => BinNums.xO (mul p y) | BinNums.xH => y end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.mul (_ _)%positive_scope
BinPos.Pos.SqrtSpec_sind : forall P : BinNums.positive * BinPos.Pos.mask -> BinNums.positive -> SProp, (forall s x : BinNums.positive, x = BinPos.Pos.mul s s -> P (s, BinPos.Pos.IsNul) x) -> (forall s r x : BinNums.positive, x = BinPos.Pos.add (BinPos.Pos.mul s s) r -> BinPos.Pos.le r (BinNums.xO s) -> P (s, BinPos.Pos.IsPos r) x) -> forall (p : BinNums.positive * BinPos.Pos.mask) (p0 : BinNums.positive), BinPos.Pos.SqrtSpec p p0 -> P p p0
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive SqrtSpec : BinNums.positive * BinPos.Pos.mask -> BinNums.positive -> Prop := SqrtExact : forall s x : BinNums.positive, x = BinPos.Pos.mul s s -> BinPos.Pos.SqrtSpec (s, BinPos.Pos.IsNul) x | SqrtApprox : forall s r x : BinNums.positive, x = BinPos.Pos.add (BinPos.Pos.mul s s) r -> BinPos.Pos.le r (BinNums.xO s) -> BinPos.Pos.SqrtSpec (s, BinPos.Pos.IsPos r) x Arguments BinPos.Pos.SqrtSpec _ _%positive_scope Arguments BinPos.Pos.SqrtExact (_ _)%positive_scope Arguments BinPos.Pos.SqrtApprox (_ _ _)%positive_scope
BinIntDef.Z.compare = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => Eq | BinNums.Zpos _ => Lt | BinNums.Zneg _ => Gt end | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinPos.Pos.compare x' y' | _ => Gt end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Zneg y' => CompOpp (BinPos.Pos.compare x' y') | _ => Lt end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> comparison Arguments BinIntDef.Z.compare (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive ascii : Set := Ascii : bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> Ascii.ascii Arguments Ascii.Ascii (_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _)%bool_scope
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
Ring_theory.SRsub : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> R) -> R -> R -> R
BinInt.Z.eq_dec : forall x y : BinNums.Z, {x = y} + {x <> y}
BinNat.N.eqf = fun f g : BinNums.N -> bool => forall n : BinNums.N, f n = g n : (BinNums.N -> bool) -> (BinNums.N -> bool) -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
Inductive string : Set := EmptyString : String.string | String : Ascii.ascii -> String.string -> String.string Arguments String.String _%char_scope
List.fold_right : forall A B : Type, (B -> A -> A) -> A -> list B -> A
BinIntDef.Z.pred = fun x : BinNums.Z => BinIntDef.Z.add x (BinNums.Zneg BinNums.xH) : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pred _%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.succ = fun x : BinNums.Z => BinIntDef.Z.add x (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.succ _%Z_scope
Tauto.eval_clause : forall Env Term' Annot : Type, (Env -> Term' -> Prop) -> Env -> Tauto.clause Term' Annot -> Prop
Tauto.eval_cnf : forall Env Term' Annot : Type, (Env -> Term' -> Prop) -> Env -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot -> Prop
```intros. intros H x y Hop. unfold is_opposite in Hop. destruct Hop as [H1 [H2 H3]]. apply BinInt.Z.compare_eq in H3. apply H3.```

original: intros. intros H x y Hop. unfold is_opposite in Hop. destruct Hop as [H1 [H2 H3]]. apply BinInt.Z.compare_eq in H3. apply H3.
